mcqs.question: Which of the following is the correct file extension for an HTML file?
mcqs.explanation: Both `.html` and `.htm` are valid file extensions for HTML files, but `.html` is more commonly used.

mcqs.question: What is the maximum recommended length for a file name including its extension?
mcqs.explanation: 255 characters is the maximum recommended length for file names on most modern file systems.

mcqs.question: What is the typical name given to the default home page file of a website?
mcqs.explanation: `index.html` is the standard name for the default home page on most web servers.

mcqs.question: Which of the following file names is best for search engine optimization (SEO)?
mcqs.explanation: Using lowercase letters and hyphens, like `about-us.html`, is best for SEO and readability.

mcqs.question: Which of the following file names is invalid for an HTML file?
mcqs.explanation: File names should not contain spaces. Use hyphens or underscores instead.

mcqs.question: Which character is recommended to use as a separator in HTML file names?
mcqs.explanation: Hyphens are recommended as separators in HTML file names for clarity and SEO.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid reason for using lowercase letters in HTML file names?
options: To make the file name longer
mcqs.explanation: Using lowercase letters does not make file names longer, but it is good for consistency and compatibility.

mcqs.question: Which file extension should NOT be used for HTML documents?
mcqs.explanation: .txt is a text file extension, not for HTML documents.

mcqs.question: If you name your HTML file `index.HTML`, will it work on all servers?
options: Yes, on Windows but not on Linux
Yes, but may cause issues on case-sensitive servers
mcqs.explanation: Case-sensitive servers (like Linux) treat `index.html` and `index.HTML` as different files.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is best practice when naming HTML files?
mcqs.explanation: Use lowercase letters and hyphens for compatibility and readability.
